src:
pub struct ExtractIf<
    'a,
    T,
    F,
    #[unstable(feature = "allocator_api", issue = "32838")] A: Allocator = Global,
>
doc_adt:
An iterator which uses a closure to determine if an element should be removed.

 This struct is created by [`Vec::extract_if`].
 See its documentation for more.

 # Example

 ```
 let mut v = vec![0, 1, 2];
 let iter: std::vec::ExtractIf<'_, _, _> = v.extract_if(.., |x| *x % 2 == 0);
 ```

VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(1)).name: idx
VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(1)).doc: The index of the item that will be inspected by the next call to `next`.

VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(2)).name: end
VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(2)).doc: Elements at and beyond this point will be retained. Must be equal or smaller than `old_len`.

VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(3)).name: del
VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(3)).doc: The number of items that have been drained (removed) thus far.

VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(4)).name: old_len
VariantIdx(None)-FieldIdx(Some(4)).doc: The original length of `vec` prior to draining.
